meanings.definition: To apply a new layer of gold to something.
meanings.sent1: She will regild the picture frame to make it shiny.
meanings.sent2: The artisan will regild the statue to enhance its beauty.
meanings.sent3: After the accident, they decided to regild the damaged trophy for the winner.
meanings.sent4: The setting sun seemed to regild the entire landscape with its golden light.
meanings.sent5: The old clock was regilded, transforming it into a gleaming timepiece once again.

meanings.definition: To restore something to its original state by adding gold.
meanings.sent1: The craftsman will regild the antique mirror to bring back its former glory.
meanings.sent2: It was a tradition to regild the family heirloom every decade.
meanings.sent3: The magician's wand could regild any object with a touch of gold.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to regild the room with warmth and happiness.
meanings.sent5: The old crown was regilded, making it shine like a beacon of history.

meanings.definition: To make something look new or fresh by adding gold.
meanings.sent1: The artist decided to regild the frame of the painting for the art show.
meanings.sent2: The sunlight seemed to regild the leaves of the trees in the park.
meanings.sent3: The chef's secret ingredient could regild any dish with a touch of luxury.
meanings.sent4: Her smile could regild even the gloomiest of days with its brightness.
meanings.sent5: The old jewelry box was regilded, turning it into a dazzling treasure chest.
